function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reliance on statistical approaches may overlook important factors impacting disease propagation.","Impact":"Failure to account for key factors may lead to inaccurate estimates of infection growth rates and policy effectiveness.","Mitigation":"Combine statistical approaches with process-based models to capture a more comprehensive understanding of disease propagation; validate statistical findings with empirical data.","Technologies":"Process-based modeling, data validation and cross-referencing tools.","People":"Epidemiologists, data scientists, policy makers.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Inaccurate data on infections due to differences in reporting at subnational levels.","Impact":"Misleading estimates of infection growth rates and policy effectiveness; ineffective policies and interventions.","Mitigation":"Standardize reporting protocols and data collection methods across subnational locations; cross-validate data with multiple sources to identify and correct discrepancies.","Technologies":"Data harmonization tools, geospatial data analysis, data validation and cross-referencing tools.","People":"Epidemiologists, data analysts, public health organizations.","Owner":"Government health agencies, research institutions."},{"Description":"Lack of consideration for demographic and socioeconomic factors may bias policy recommendations.","Impact":"Unintended consequences of implemented policies on vulnerable populations; unequal distribution of disease burden.","Mitigation":"Incorporate demographic and socioeconomic data into analysis; conduct equity assessments of proposed policies; consult with affected communities.","Technologies":"Data integration tools, demographic and socioeconomic data analysis, equity impact assessment tools.","People":"Policy makers, community leaders, public health advocates.","Owner":"Government agencies, policy research organizations."}]}
